outboundReferences.contextLine: It may happen that an event is so big that it impacts a whole [[azure-region]]. In that case, [[azure-availability-zones]] are not enough to prevent data loss and application downtime. Therefore, we need to pair regions so that one acts as a fallback for the other.

It may happen that an event is so big that it impacts a whole [[azure-region]]. In that case, [[azure-availability-zones]] are not enough to prevent data loss and application downtime. Therefore, we need to pair regions so that one acts as a fallback for the other.

inboundReferences.contextLine: When creating a storage account, you must select the primary region. The paired secondary region is assigned automatically, based on [[azure-region-pairs]], and cannot be changed.

There is a **physical structure**, in which every datacenter is located in an [[azure-availability-zones]], each Availability zone is located within an [[azure-region]], and Regions are coupled in [[azure-region-pairs]].
